skill.name: drugbank-database
skill.description: Access and analyze comprehensive drug information from the DrugBank database including drug properties, interactions, targets, pathways, chemical structures, and pharmacology data. This skill should be used when working with pharmaceutical data, drug discovery research, pharmacology studies, drug-drug interaction analysis, target identification, chemical similarity searches, ADMET predictions, or any task requiring detailed drug and drug target information from DrugBank.
skill.summary: Access and analyze comprehensive drug information from the DrugBank database including drug properti...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate scientific skill for accessing the DrugBank bioinformatics database. All 342 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the analyzer misinterpreting Markdown code block syntax and bioinformatics terminology. The skill uses the official drugbank-downloader package for authenticated access to a recognized public database.

content.value_statement: DrugBank is a comprehensive bioinformatics database containing detailed drug information. This skill enables programmatic access to drug properties, interactions, targets, pathways, and chemical structures for pharmacology research and drug discovery.
actual_capabilities: Access drug properties, pharmacology, and clinical data by DrugBank ID
Extract drug-drug interactions and build interaction networks
Query drug targets, enzymes, transporters, and biological pathways
Calculate chemical properties, similarity, and ADMET predictions
Search drugs by name, CAS number, or keywords
Build searchable drug datasets and export to DataFrames
limitations: Requires valid DrugBank account credentials for database access
Latest version access may require paid commercial license
Chemical similarity analysis requires RDKit package installation

use_cases.title: Drug mechanism research
use_cases.description: Extract mechanism of action, pharmacodynamics, and ADME data for drug candidates

use_cases.title: Interaction safety analysis
use_cases.description: Check drug-drug interactions for polypharmacy regimens and identify contraindications

use_cases.title: Similarity-based repurposing
use_cases.description: Find structurally similar drugs to identify potential repurposing candidates

prompt_templates.title: Get drug information
prompt_templates.prompt: Get information for drug DB00001 including name, type, indication, and mechanism of action

prompt_templates.title: Check drug interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if aspirin (DB00945) and warfarin (DB00682) have any known drug-drug interactions

prompt_templates.title: Find drug targets
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all protein targets for metformin (DB00331) and their UniProt IDs

prompt_templates.title: Chemical similarity search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find 5 drugs structurally similar to aspirin based on Tanimoto similarity

output_examples.input: Get information for ibuprofen including its drug-drug interactions
output: Indication: Treatment of pain, inflammation, and fever
Major interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding risk), Aspirin (reduced cardioprotection), Lithium (increased levels)
Targets: Prostaglandin G/H synthases 1 and 2 (COX-1, COX-2)

best_practices: Use environment variables for DrugBank credentials, never hardcode them
Specify exact DrugBank version for reproducible research
Cache parsed XML data to avoid repeated downloads and parsing
anti_patterns: Using outdated DrugBank versions without version specification
Ignoring interaction severity classifications in safety analysis
Trusting predicted ADMET properties without experimental validation

faq.question: How do I get DrugBank access credentials?
faq.answer: Create a free account at go.drugbank.com and accept the academic license agreement

faq.question: Is commercial use allowed?
faq.answer: Academic use is free. Commercial use requires a paid DrugBank license

faq.question: What Python packages do I need?
faq.answer: Install drugbank-downloader, lxml, pandas, rdkit, networkx, and scikit-learn

faq.question: Can I search drugs by name?
faq.answer: Yes, use the search_by_name function with exact or partial matching

faq.question: How do I check multiple drug interactions?
faq.answer: Use check_polypharmacy() with a list of DrugBank IDs to find all pairwise interactions

faq.question: What chemical properties are available?
faq.answer: SMILES, InChI, molecular weight, logP, polar surface area, and Lipinski's Rule of Five compliance
